column4: hello all, a friend is trying to install ubuntu and needs to shrink his NTFS partition but the install is not letting him..  are there any easy to follow links about this?
anyone know how to shrink an NTFS partition?
is there a guide somewhere explaining how to do it?
np, remember to back up your data :)
yeah it's actually a friend that will be doing it, and I've told him to backup but he has nowhere to backup to so yeah
do you know if gparted is on the livecd?
sorry, i was away. if someone else didnt answer you, yes gparted is on the live cd.
lol it's cool someone answered, thanks though...  do you know if gparted will double-check to make sure there aren't any stray files at the end of the partition before shrinking?
really, im not sure. i would guess so yes.
eep!  I guess they will just have to trust it :p
if what Creationist says is true, then im not sure if its on the live cd now. anyways you can just apt-get it from the live session

I totally missed that conversation the first time :p I find it hard to filter stuff through everyone talking in here..  Does that mean it's not necessary to run gparted separately but that it will be run by the installer as part of installation?
yes you can use it through the installer, but you can also apt-get it in the live session.
ok cool, I think it would be easier for my friend to run it via the installer.. thanks
